newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bonn hails flawed Bosnia polls as important step.
newsitem.headline: Bonn hails flawed Bosnia polls as important step.

text.p: German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel hailed Bosnia's first post-war elections, saying on Sunday they may have been flawed but they constituted an important step on the path to democracy.

Kinkel said in a statement he hoped Saturday's elections marked the beginning of political normality. A few irregularities were to be expected but this did not detract from the polls' significance, he added.

"A further important step towards the implementation of the Dayton peace agreement has been achieved. This is an essential step on the path to democracy so that the ethnic groups can live together in this long-suffering country," the statement said.

Almost three million electors were eligible to vote for the collective Bosnian national presidency and parliament, a president and national assembly for the Serb republic and an assembly and cantonal administrations for the federation.
Kinkel called for a date to be set by the end of the year for local elections in Bosnia, which have been postponed.
